sections.heading: Printing
paragraphs: The print() function displays text or values on the screen â€” like saying 'show this to the user'.

sections.heading: Comments
paragraphs: Comments are notes for humans. Python ignores them when running code. Use them to explain your code or temporarily disable lines.

sections.heading: Single-line comments
bullets: print("Hello")  # This is also a comment

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Write a print() statement that says your name.
Add a single-line comment explaining what the code does.
Add a multi-line comment about your favorite hobby.
Use # for single-line and triple quotes for multi-line comments
Comments do not change how code runs
